intro: Tithymalus alaicus, commonly known as the Crimean tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the Crimean Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded locations. Tithymalus alaicus is often found in rocky or limestone habitats, showcasing its adaptability to specific environmental conditions.
